Classics & Religious Studies - Classics.1: Be familiar with the academic methods associated with the discipline of Classics.
Classics & Religious Studies - Classics.2: Demonstrate knowledge of the basic elements comprising the civilization and culture of the ancient Mediterranean world and its impact upon subsequent western culture.
Classics & Religious Studies - Classics.3: Demonstrate an ability to analyze an ancient text and/or artifact in terms of its historical context and defining characteristics.
Classics & Religious Studies - Classics.4: Relate important concepts from the sphere of Greek and Latin culture and its heritage to the contemporary world.

Classics & Religious Studies - Religious.1: Learn about the academic study of religion and its approach to discussing religion and religious differences.
Classics & Religious Studies - Religious.2: Identify major world religious traditions on the basis of distinguishing features such as beliefs, laws and practices, rituals, scriptures, and institutions.
Classics & Religious Studies - Religious.3: Explain how religious world views interpret human experience, the ways that social and historical change can affect religious traditions and how communities can in turn influence their surrounding culture.
